message.content:
cs.NI, cs.LG, cs.IT, cs.SY, cs.MM

The paper discusses the use of machine learning for improving the efficiency of car-to-cloud communication in the context of upcoming 5G networks. This involves predicting the behavior of the communication context and scheduling data transmission accordingly. Given the focus on communication networks and machine learning, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). The paper also involves the use of machine learning algorithms, which suggests a possible fit with cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper discusses the optimization of system performance, which could fall under cs.IT (Information Theory). The use of predictive models for scheduling data transmission could also be seen as a control systems problem, which could fit under cs.SY (Systems and Control). Finally, the paper involves the use of sensor data, which could suggest a possible fit with cs.MM (Multimedia).
